SEARCH
Package org.projectsw.View

Class TextualUI

java.lang.Object
org.projectsw.Util.Observable<InputMessage>
org.projectsw.View.TextualUI
public class TextualUI extends Observable<InputMessage>
The TextualUI class represents a textual user interface for a game. It provides methods to interact with the user through the command line interface. This class extends the Observable class and implements the Runnable interface.

    • run

      public void run()
      Runs the textual user interface.

    • ending

      public void ending()
      Performs the necessary actions when the game ends. Closes the scanner, sets the flag to false, and prints messages. If the nickname is the last player's nickname, asks for results, waits for return, and kills the client.

    • exit

      public void exit()
      Exits the game. Notifies the observers with the necessary input to perform cleanup actions and end the game. Handles network errors by throwing a RuntimeException.

    • update

      public void update(ResponseMessage response)
      Updates the client based on the received response message. Executes the response if the alphanumeric ID matches the client's key or the broadcast ID.
      Parameters:
      response - the response message to process and execute

    • chooseColumn

      public boolean chooseColumn()
      Prompts the user to choose a column. Returns true if the user chooses to proceed, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      true if the user chooses to proceed, false otherwise

    • selectTemporaryTileInput

      public Integer selectTemporaryTileInput()
      Prompts the user to select a temporary tile input. Returns the selected tile number minus one.
      Returns:
      the selected tile number minus one

    • selectColumnInput

      public Integer selectColumnInput()
      Prompts the user to select a column input. Returns the selected column number minus one.
      Returns:
      the selected column number minus one

    • askNameAgainForReload

      public void askNameAgainForReload()
      Prompts the player to enter their previous nickname when reloading a game from a file. Sends the entered nickname to the server and waits for a response.

    • askNickname

      public void askNickname()
      Prompts the player to enter their nickname. If the `nickFlag` is set to true, the player can enter their nickname. If the `nickFlag` is set to false, an error message is displayed. If the player is reconnecting to a game, it calls the `reconnectionJoin()` method. Sends the entered nickname to the server and waits for a response.

    • askNumber

      public void askNumber()
      Prompts the first player to enter the number of players. If the `firstPlayerFlag` is set to true, the player can enter the number of players. If the `firstPlayerFlag` is set to false, an error message is displayed. Uses a `Scanner` to read the user input and validates the entered number. Sends the entered number of players to the server and waits for a response. Updates the `firstPlayerFlag` and `nickFlag` accordingly.

    • askLoadGame

      public void askLoadGame()
      Prompts the first player to choose whether to load a previous game or not. If the `firstPlayerFlag` is true and a previous game exists, the player can choose to load the game. If the `firstPlayerFlag` is false or no previous game exists, an error message is displayed. Uses a `Scanner` to read the user input. Sends the load game selection to the server and waits for a response. Prompts the player to enter their previous nickname and sends it to the server. Updates the `nickFlag` and `firstPlayerFlag` accordingly.

    • showBoard

      public void showBoard(SerializableGame model)
      Displays the current game board.
      Parameters:
      model - The SerializableGame object containing the game board.

    • showShelf

      public void showShelf(SerializableGame model)
      Displays the current shelf.
      Parameters:
      model - The SerializableGame object containing the shelf.

    • showAllShelves

      public void showAllShelves(SerializableGame model)
      Displays all the shelves.
      Parameters:
      model - The SerializableGame object containing all the shelves.

      public void showPersonalGoal(SerializableGame model)
      Displays the personal goal.
      Parameters:
      model - The SerializableGame object containing the personal goal.

    • showCommonGoals

      public void showCommonGoals(SerializableGame model)
      Displays the common goals.
      Parameters:
      model - The SerializableGame object containing the common goals.

    • showCurrentPlayer

      public void showCurrentPlayer(SerializableGame model)
      Displays the current player.
      Parameters:
      model - The SerializableGame object containing the current player.

    • kill

      public void kill(int option)
      Terminates the client process. If the `option` is 0, it indicates that the client was unable to join the game because the lobby is full. In this case, an error message is displayed, and the process is closed after printing an image. Otherwise, the `kill()` method of the client is called to terminate the process. If an error occurs while closing the process, a message is displayed instructing the user to manually close the client. Finally, the process is exited with a status of 0.
      Parameters:
      option - the option indicating the reason for the termination

    • printMedal

      public void printMedal(String metal, String place)
      Displays the results medals using colored console output.

    • printNoMedal

      public void printNoMedal()
      Displays the cobweb using colored console output.

    • addBufferMessage

      public void addBufferMessage(Message message)
      Adds a message to the chat buffer.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to be added to the buffer.

    • writeBufferMessage

      public void writeBufferMessage()
      Prints the messages stored in the chat buffer and clears the buffer.
